thread.title: Totally rad: Jersey-set '80s comedy 'Red Oaks' debuts on Amazon
thread.title_full: Totally rad: Jersey-set '80s comedy 'Red Oaks' debuts on Amazon

author: Vicki Hyman | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Totally rad: Jersey-set '80s comedy 'Red Oaks' debuts on Amazon
text:
Comments 
Strap on your fanny pack and slide on your leg warmers — the New Jersey-set coming-of-age comedy "Red Oaks" begins streaming on Amazon today. 
"Red Oaks," a deliberate throwback to classic '80s summer comedies such as "Caddyshack" but less reliant on '80s shtick than "The Goldbergs," stars Craig Roberts as David Myers, a college student uncertain about his future who is working as an assistant tennis pro at his local country club for the summer. 
The cast includes Richard Kind as David's father, who makes an embarrassingly revealing confession on his, as it turns out, not-deathbed, and '80s icon Jennifer Grey ("Dirty Dancing") as his maybe-lesbian mother, with Paul Reiser as the obnoxious country club president who has a rebellious daughter whom David (despite his own blond aerobicized girlfriend) takes a liking to. 
REVIEW: 'Red Oaks' the pick of Amazon's pilot season 
Partially shot at River Vale's Edgewood County Club, the show as created by Gregory Jacobs, a Harrington Park native and frequent Steven Soderbergh collaborator (he took over the "Magic Mike" franchise from Soderbergh earlier this year) who worked as a tennis pro during his college summers, and screenwriter Joe Gangemi. 
Amazon's business model — greenlighting series in part based on viewer feedback of the pilots and releasing an entire season at once — appealed to Jacobs , he told Inside Jersey earlier this year. "It's exciting, this idea of television. You can really turn it into a five-hour movie. It is a really great way to tell a story. It gives you a lot of places to go, and it also enables us to develop not just David's character, but the ensemble." 
Vicki Hyman may be reached at vhyman@njadvancemedia.com . Follow her on Twitter @vickihy . Find NJ.com/Entertainment on Facebook .
